I have no doubt that there is a huge possibility of a drop, but this is something that you and I (I'm assuming you're under 30) would want most. I would be thinking a lot differently right now if I was 65 on the verge of retirement and had all my money in common stock. Lets let it ride baby.

Investing is long term and you should never invest without an expectation that markets are going to heavily fluctuate. It has happened throughout all of history. Just because a market is down doesn't mean that you stop buying. They did a test of 23 year purchase periods and every single test showed a profit either at the close of the purchase period or within 5 years thereafter through dollar cost averaging. Average profits at the end of these 23 periods was 21.5%. The sky is not falling. Slow and steady wins the race. The market has still been far more overvalued at many other points in the past than it is today.
Bad play, I think that the price is already reflecting its expected prosperity.
